meanings.definition: Capable of being transferred from one person to another, typically through blood transfusion.
meanings.sent1: The hospital always needs more transfusable blood for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The red blood cells are transfusable to patients in need of a transfusion.
meanings.sent3: The vampire found the idea of transfusable blood quite convenient.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as transfusable as a life-saving donation.
meanings.sent5: The concept of transfusable blood can save lives in critical situations.

meanings.definition: Able to be moved or passed from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transfusable goods were easily transported to the new location.
meanings.sent2: The lightweight boxes were transfusable between different storage areas.
meanings.sent3: The idea of transfusable furniture seemed practical for frequent movers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as transfusable as joy spreading from one person to another.
meanings.sent5: The concept of transfusable energy can help in reducing waste and costs.
